title: Add ASIN and Product Name fields to product data

requirements.summary: Display ASIN field prominently in ProductCard component with clear labeling and monospace styling
acceptanceCriteria: ASIN is displayed on each product card
ASIN uses monospace or distinctive styling for readability

file_operations.description: Add ASIN display near the product title or category information. Use monospace font styling for the 10-character alphanumeric identifier. Include a clear label such as 'ASIN:' and ensure the styling is distinctive and readable in both light and dark modes. Position the ASIN field in a prominent location within the card layout, potentially near the top alongside category information.

requirements.summary: Ensure product name is displayed as the primary heading in ProductCard with proper text handling
acceptanceCriteria: Product name is the most prominent text element on the card
Product name supports text truncation or wrapping for long titles
Product name is clearly visible in both light and dark modes

file_operations.description: Verify that the product name (productName field from Product type) is displayed as the primary heading element with appropriate text sizing and weight. Implement text truncation or wrapping to handle long Amazon product titles gracefully. Ensure the heading uses appropriate Tailwind classes for visibility in both theme modes. If the current implementation uses a different field name for the product title, update it to use the productName field from the backend Product type.

requirements.summary: Update frontend Product type definition to include asin and productName fields for type safety
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript Product interface includes asin: string field
TypeScript Product interface includes productName or title: string field
No type errors in components using Product type

file_operations.description: Verify that the Product interface includes both asin: string and productName: string fields. The backend interface shows these fields are already present in the Product type. Ensure no additional modifications are needed and that the type definition matches the backend Product type exactly. If any discrepancies exist between the frontend type and backend type, align them to ensure type safety across all frontend components using the Product type.
